name: NPR
text:
Drugmaker AstraZeneca says it's pausing its COVID-19 vaccine trial because of a "potentially unexplained illness" in one of the trial volunteers. 

A safety review will be conducted to determine if it's a chance event or somehow related to the vaccine.
https://t.co/gt3NQMxnwm

name: NPR
text:
Peru's per capita death rate from COVID-19 is higher than almost any other nation. Now, its government has launched an emotional public-awareness campaign to fight the spread.

Its slogan: “COVID does not kill by itself. Let’s not be accomplices.”
https://t.co/qPDGsI6Pu1

name: NPR
text:
An attorney hired by Trump appointee Michael Pack to investigate Voice of America's coverage for potential anti-Trump bias has an active court order against him — stemming from a complaint that he made detailed death threats against his father.
https://t.co/7mTljlDB1t

name: NPR
text:
Japan's Olympic minister says the Tokyo Olympics should move forward in 2021 "at any cost."

Multiple officials in the past week have stressed that the games will proceed regardless of the state of the COVID-19 pandemic.
https://t.co/jt1MafdjW4

name: NPR
text:
Three firefighters have been hospitalized after battling the growing Dolan Fire in central California on Tuesday. One remains in critical condition, officials say.

https://t.co/G3siUpbl0i

name: NPR
text: RT @kcur: No Compromise from @NPR and @GunsReporting is here. @TwitrHagen and @ChrisHaxel report on a family that has used Facebook to spread their hard line vision of gun rights. Listen to the first episode wherever you download your podcasts. https://t.co/kjBBv7dWoi https://t.co/WkuhTdqzvr

name: NPR
text:
Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte granted an "absolute pardon" to a U.S. marine convicted of killing a trans woman in 2014.

He had initially been sentenced to a term of 6 to 12 years for homicide — a sentence that was later reduced to 10 years.
https://t.co/WIpbCvFSQG

name: NPR
text:
Many Black Americans who spoke with NPR said that while they don't believe this current movement will change much today, they hope it'll help lead to change for generations to come.
https://t.co/ozPPR55gQN

name: NPR
text:
If math makes you a little nervous, you’re not the only one. You could even pass that anxiety along to your children. 

But there are strategies to make sure your kids grow up confident with numbers. Here are some tips to get started. (@nprlifekit)
https://t.co/BzTq7YFBsD

name: NPR
text:
Nearly half of America's child care centers could be permanently lost because of the pandemic, researchers warn.

Economists say that'll make it hard for parents to get back to work — and is likely to disproportionately affect women.
https://t.co/l6McUW5gM0

name: NPR
text:
Experts say eating disorders have a strong link to trauma — and they're thriving during the pandemic. That poses a lethal threat, as they have the second-highest mortality rate of any psychiatric diagnosis.
https://t.co/aKWJgDpEGl

name: NPR
text: School is back in session, but under circumstances that are vastly different for millions of children in the U.S. Today on #NPRConsider, we hear from teachers and coaches who are trying to navigate their way through a pandemic with their students. https://t.co/Fsfw5eQ8Sp
